definition[0]: one of the separate units that a course of study has been divided into. Usually students choose a number of modules to study
example[1]: You choose five modules in the first year.
definition[1]: one of several parts of a piece of computer software that does a particular job
definition[2]: a part of a spacecraft that can be separated from the main part and used for a particular purpose
definition[3]: one of several separate parts that can be combined to form a larger object, such as a machine or building
definition[4]: one of several separate parts that can be combined to form a larger thing
example[2]: Software is often written in modules by teams of programmers.
definition[5]: one of the units that a course of study has been divided into, each of which can be studied separately
